data: {"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3150950,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T02:13:42.746Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe got our arm moving and have basic positional control which is fairly accurate. We set a closed loop ramp rate which work great for softening the start but does nothing to soften the stop.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eI know the right way to do this control is with a trapezoidal profile but have yet to figure that out so currently trying with just a PID to get it working first. Then moving that way.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp\u003eWhat is the best way to get it to ramp down as well as up\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T02:13:42.746Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":33,"reads":64,"readers_count":63,"score":177.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":427790,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-positional-control-question","display_username":"Dan Langdon","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51496,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-positional-control-question/427790/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3150953,"name":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/slab-mr.thomas/{size}/182153_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T02:22:31.541Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eI think you need to define exactly what you want the PID controller to do and think through if that is possible with the PID controller running. PID controller naturally eases into a setpoint since the change in output is proportional to the error and the error diminishes as you approach. If you detect you are at the setpoint you likely stop or if the PID controller is needed to hold the position then it is gently doing so. This all assumes your kP is well tuned - not too big. Please describe, say with a graph, what is happening and what you want to happen.\u003c/p\u003e","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2023-02-23T02:23:54.001Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":60,"readers_count":59,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427790,"topic_slug":"sparkmax-positional-control-question","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/sparkmax-positional-control-question/427790/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150959,"name":"Dan Langdon","username":"woodworker2001","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/bbe5ce/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-23T02:30:37.187Z","cooked":"\u003cp\u003eWe just got the arm moving really and have not done much tuning and are currently only using a p term but it is achieving an acceptable accuracy for the time being. It gets to its set point but stops abruptly.
